encodingDesc.p: The file data/letters/1890-6/1890/90-04-00-final.doc was converted from Microsoft Word format into TEI using an XProc pipeline.

head.supplied: At last I have demonstrated the long expected occurrence of ¶ Cyrtandra ¶ in Australia. Unfortunately there was only one (mutilated) fruit, and were only two imperfect flowers sacrificed in analysis...

p.seg: K831735 Cyrtandra baileyi, Herbarium, RBG Kew.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The letter is attached to a sheet with the specimen. M's label also attached is 'Cyrtandra Baileyi | FvM | Mt Bellindin Ker | 1888 W. Sayer' [i.e. Mt Bellenden Ker]. Both the letter and the label are dated stamped '19 May 90'. Letter dated to April 1890 as the latest it could have been sent, to reach Kew by mid-May. The MS may have been included with M to W. Thiselton-Dyer, 6 April 1890 (in this edition as 90-04-06a) which is also date stamped 19 May 1890.

p.seg: At last I have demonstrated the long expected occurrence of
in Australia. Unfortunately there was only one (mutilated) fruit, and were only two imperfect flowers sacrificed in analysis;

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: sacrificed in analysis marginal note with intended position indicated by an asterisk.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The species was described, with M credited as author, in Bailey (1890), pp. 51-2.

p.seg: so I can only supply leaves on a branchlet to you. We ought to find also
p.name: Aeschynanthus

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: APNI (accessed 11 June 2021) does not list any species of this for Australia.
